attributes.action: Increase the penalties for harming protected birds on grouse moors
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The average 7,000 acre grouse moor will make its owner in the region of £200K profit p.a. from shoots during grouse season. 

The potential fine of £10,000 for anyone caught poisoning a protected bird of prey - which threaten the success of the grouse shoots - is clearly insufficient to act as a deterrent. At a minimum, allowing protected species to be harmed or killed on a grouse moor should result in the revocation of shooting licenses, and possibly further sanctions.
